tripreview.Title: "Trendy Kochi spot"
tripreview.sentence: Is a good place to relax and have a quick snack : nicely decorated, very young and happy staff and a mixed clientele of locals and expats, mainly young people and in a very friendly atmosphere.
The food is correct, an Indian version of western cafe's choice (sandwiches, salads, pasta).

tripreview.Title: "Lovely french press coffee"
tripreview.sentence: This is a lovely cafe, set in a tiny lane.
It's in a great location and has really good french press coffee and cakes.
It's not air conditioned so keeping a mosquito repellent handy is a good idea during the evenings, though the cafe has placed a few electric insect zappers (that's what I call it) around.
The art is well placed so you enjoy it as you sip your coffee.

tripreview.Title: "Not much in terms of art"
tripreview.sentence: Has a nice cafe.
Decent food.
Their ice tea is superb.
Nice place to take a break from walking.
Quaint inside.

tripreview.Title: "Is it up to its hype? "
tripreview.sentence: Went there at about 11am, first things first.
If you are driving yourself, Google map is spot on.
Pls note that u can't really Park your car next to kashi as the street it's on is quite narrow.
But about 2 metres from this place you have a recreational Park by which you can park your car for 30 rupees.
It's quite unassuming from the outside.
But the moment u step in, it opens up into a courtyard setting with open areas in the ceiling.
So you have a lovely natural lighting thing going on.
Quite a bit of greenery on the walls as well.
And of course a ton of art work.
Be warned though, you will only be served lunch after the requisite 12 pm deadline.
And not a minute before that.
It's nice to know that they actually stick to what's written on their menu.
Coming to the menu it's quite limited but that being said I believe because of this they maintain a high quality of standard when it comes to their food.
The menu is your typical cafe/bistro menu.
The servings of fresh fruit on their French toast was humongous.
Their produce is definitely quite fresh.
The place is also well maintained.
Nice and clean.
But it does fill up quite quickly.
They don't do reservations on Sundays (personal experience).
Their lunch menu is decent with a bunch of sandwiches and lasagne etc.
The taste is definitely above average but I wouldn't call it earth shattering.
Kochi is filled with tons of places like this so it's kinda hard to be fair to this place.
To be fair, it's definitely gonna be awesome for foreigners to sit about and chill out for a few hours.
The ambience is dainty and very Goa(ish).
And like some reviewers have said before, good place to read a book.
Of course there is no alcohol served which I personally feel is a good call.
For Indians, well I'm not too sure about the place.
I mean it's ok.
It's definitely not your typical keralite haunt.
So it's nice in that sense.
But then again Fort Kochi is filled with these hole in the wall type of places.
So for me it's up in the air.
Oh and price wise it's pretty decent.
And the staff is quite decent as well.
Pretty attentive.
Give it a shot.
At least once.
So is it up to the hype?
For backpackers, yes.
For hardcore foodies, no.

tripreview.Title: "A place that truly justifies the term Comfort Food"
tripreview.sentence: While browsing through Trip-adviser we found this place as #1 attraction in Cochin.
But I was shocked when I found this place on Zomato as well!
Because as the name suggests, I thought it to be a Art gallery as there are many of them in Cochin.
But after reading the reviews we decided to give it a try in Fort Cochin.
The place is little difficult to find as it resides in a narrow lane.
So basically this is place which has different exhibits in the front room depending upon the 'Artist of the month' theme.
You get to read a bit about the artist and his/her style etc.
Next room has a small kitchen basically meant for small items like coffee / tea etc.
It is a old house which is well converted into a hangout place.
We tried Seafood Wrap and Tune Sandwich.
I was baffled by the name Seafood role and out of habit asked for which fish it will have.
The answer was all fish which baffled me more, but when the order arrived on the table it turned out to be as the man said.
All type of fish with small hint of spicy mayo which let the taste of all the fishes to come out.
Ambience and service quality was awesome.
It made our day and helped us to cool down during the sunny afternoon.

tripreview.Title: "Coffee and Art"
tripreview.sentence: The aromas of freshly brewed coffee and fruit scones greeted me as I walked through the gallery- cafe.
The perfume of fresh fruit juice being made in the open kitchen beckons you to stay a while, admiring the modern-edgy decor, and prominent art displays.
I highly recommend a visit to Kashi for a morning meal or to escape the intense Kerala heat of the day.

tripreview.Title: "Peaceful, tasty and yet quietly buzzing!."
tripreview.sentence: One of the best spots in Fort Kochi for daytime chowing, morning lazing and general art browsing.
The bread, cakes, juices and teas are the perfect way to revitalise after a walk around amazing Fort Kochi.
Omelettes are epic, juices tangy and staff super friendly.
give it a visit!

tripreview.Title: "Perfect place for people when (not if) they get bored of local food"
tripreview.sentence: It was our last day in Kerala and we were bored of localized food (not just south indian but north indian localized) but this was indeed a delight.
It has a short and small menu largely catered to non-veg eaters but there are a few options for veg lovers as well.
Sandwiches are nice (Cheese and tomato should be tried), Cold coffee and ginger lemonade are nice too.
The Cake with chocolate top is huge in portion and hence it is important that you have some appetite left for that.
For non-veg eaters, pasta and sandwiches are a must have!
Please go and enjoy this place, when (not if) you get bored of the great food served in Kerala (no pun or sarcasm intended).

tripreview.Title: "Art visit"
tripreview.sentence: Great ambience!
Great location.
Chill place.
Nice shaded area.
Close to the beach and Chinese fishing nets.

tripreview.Title: "cafe is what cafe does"
tripreview.sentence: I practically lived here for the two months I was in Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely spot! Great sandwiches"
tripreview.sentence: Peaceful spot in the guesthouse area.
Tiny oasis in kochi with great food.
Would reccomend the back of the cafe in the summer as they are ventilated with fans.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Cake !!"
tripreview.sentence: lovely respite with an excellent assortment of cakes and drinks on the menu.
Very quirky and cool lots of traveller and funky locals hanging out in an uber cool gallery/coffee shop.

tripreview.Title: "Perfect Coffee House"
tripreview.sentence: Its a coffee house with such beautiful interiors!
Its a must visit there!
Staff was courteous and sweet!
Best part, coffees were made just the way they should be!

tripreview.Title: "Best coffee shop in Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: It's beautiful, cool, with good food and art.
One of the best places to relax and have good food in town, all together.
I highly recommend the Ginger Lemonade, an omelet with fresh bread and/or a piece of their home made cakes with chocolate top, especially if it is coming right from the oven.
Besides that, the whole decoration is beautiful and it's also an art gallery, with amazing works from contemporary artists.
One of my favorites in Fort Kochi!

tripreview.Title: "wonderful art and fabulous food"
tripreview.sentence: excellent morning fruits and cakes, exceptional lunch time sandwiches and salads within a beautiful ambiance.
Our favorite daytime cafe in ft cochin!

tripreview.Title: "Cute Place"
tripreview.sentence: Didn't have any food but didn't like the coffee.
The menu mentioned espresso, so we presumed it was from a machine but in fact, it was locally brewed coffee.

tripreview.Title: "wonderful breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: if you want to have a breakfast in Kochin
this is the place to be
i loved the fruit cake and the fruit cuts all very fresh and the best part was the coffee

tripreview.Title: "Delicious Cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Lovely art filled space selling delicious food and superb French press coffee.
Filled with tourists but this is not overwhelming.
We went back several times!

tripreview.Title: "Best Cakes Ever!"
tripreview.sentence: Brilliant!
A must visit.
The surroundings are lovely, the artwork on display is superb and the food, in particular the cakes are wonderful.
Its a lovely tranquil place to escape from the heat of the day and the staff are all lovely.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Hang out"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent place to hang out with your family.
Chocolate cake is a must try.
Nice ambience and great food.

tripreview.Title: "Must go recommended it to all"
tripreview.sentence: Great place for having snacks and hanging out with friends and family.
Good ambiance and quite place.
Its really an art cafe .
Recommend it to all.

tripreview.Title: "Must go here!"
tripreview.sentence: The gallery and especially the cafe are definitely a must-go-to place in the Fort Kochi side of town.
The food does NOT have any local dishes, but would be perfect for foreigners looking for some of their food.
The ambience is superb and the service is helpful.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place to sit and chat"
tripreview.sentence: it is one of the few places available to sit and sip a cuppa or coffee and chat.

tripreview.Title: "tasty food in a cosy atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: ambience is good.
food is nice but some are bland.
in a good location.
enjoyed the ginger flavoured drink served at this place.

tripreview.Title: "Friendly"
tripreview.sentence: Artists would love this place.
The food is nice.
The ambience is excellent.
The staff is very efficient.

tripreview.Title: "Cool oasis with culture"
tripreview.sentence: Probably the best coffee in Fort Kochi.
Popped in for a caffetiere regularly, locally grown arabica in a cool shaded semi open space.
Snacky international food but very good when you're all curried out.
And the clientele are always varied and interesting.

tripreview.Title: "Very nice food"
tripreview.sentence: This is a relaxing place with a good range of European food and a nice place to visit for a taste of Europe in India if you need one.

tripreview.Title: "good place to have a lazy sunday brunch"
tripreview.sentence: A good place to have breakfast or rather a late sunday brunch.
Outstanding decor.
Lot of greenery and trendy looks.
A good place to go with family.
Dishes are reasonably priced and the best part was the diffrent kinds of preperations that they can prepare out of eggs.
Would definitely visit again while I am at Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "One of the must visits in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: The Place!
It has the best combination of a lazy chilled out cafe.
An art gallery makes it more appealing.
If you want to have a date by yourself or with some one, there aint a better place to start with in Kochi.
Nice and well dressed staff with service accompanied by warm smiles.
Tasty all day breakfast, soups and well made natural tasting juices.
One of the best press coffee ever.
Have it.
Indulge in Kashi.

tripreview.Title: "Fund and trendy"
tripreview.sentence: A fun and trendy place that took us by surprise given the surroundings.
Had great ginger refreshing drink.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent food"
tripreview.sentence: We are a family of 5 and all found something good here.
Great atmosphere, so clean and healthy food.
The juices are excellent and we had the lasagna which was delicious.
Highly recommend for lunch.
And the loos are pristine.
Interesting art too.

tripreview.Title: "go go go"
tripreview.sentence: Went there several times since quality of food and environment is just perfect.
Huge dishes that will make you get to the day.
Fresh juice and good coffee.

tripreview.Title: "Nice gallery"
tripreview.sentence: Chilled out space to sit and have a coffee.
With regular art exhibitions in a great location in Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely little cafe with plenty of art and plants"
tripreview.sentence: Very quiet and sweet little cafe-the cakes and coffee are really good.
Homemade everyday by the owner.
The art works on display add greatly to the charming feel .

tripreview.Title: "Walk to Kashi!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Where else can you find a perfect fusion, in fort kochi a small place near a hustling bustling city of Kochin.
Right in the morning when you wanna try other than south Indian menu, try Kashi Cafe, it will truly amazing experience for you and your pocket.
You can try it for breakfast, Lunch, dinner and even mid snack.
Masala Chai, french toast, omelette are really amazing options to try.
Coffee too is amazing, as they brew it nicely.
The best part is amazing portion of fresh fruits they serve with french toast and omelette.

tripreview.Title: "Gem of a cafe!"
tripreview.sentence: It's arguably the best cafe in Kochi.
The ambience is great, and the food is excellent!
The only negative is that it's not air conditioned.
Other than that, your stay at Kochi is not complete without a visit here.

tripreview.Title: "All day breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: excellent omelettes as a change from s indian food.
V good coffee.
Cheeky service.
Nice place for a stop off.

tripreview.Title: "Good place- Dfntly a GO while in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Liked - Ambiance Disliked - Menu items can be better.
Just a thought.

tripreview.Title: "Great - as always!"
tripreview.sentence: I return to Kashi for their great coffee and breakfasts and homemade cakes.
The service can be a little slow and uneven sometimes.
The young blokes working there are helpful and try hard though.
This is the place to go when you have been in India for a while and want a Western fix!

tripreview.Title: "Went there twice. Very nice atmosphere."
tripreview.sentence: We really liked this place.
Food was ok, nothing amazing, but the atmosphere is good and it's great for having a tea and chill.
The gallery part was excellent as well.
There were really cool contemporary artworks.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: A great place for a conversation, a cup of coffee/chai, a refreshing drink, or just to sit and read a book!
Beautiful peaceful decor.

tripreview.Title: "Full of tourists"
tripreview.sentence: Of course I like to go there too.
- Because I am sure to get a nice coffee and nice food as well.
Cakes are big as always and a great treat!
Only I was glad that there were some Indians as well, because I find it rather embarassing when the Westerners are just among themselves

tripreview.Title: "great escape"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place to escape from th heat and thr traffic outside.
Smart yet relaxed place.
Super staff and really good menu for lunch.

tripreview.Title: "Great cafe and meeting place"
tripreview.sentence: really good proper coffee.
Smart yet relaxed place.
Super staff and really good menu for any time of the day.

tripreview.Title: "An amazing place to be for ur breakfast"
tripreview.sentence: It is a decent place with an amazing menu.
The ambience very good with loads of people moving in and out.

tripreview.Title: "Great Food"
tripreview.sentence: We were taken to Kashi's after our bike tour in Kerala.
It was a relief to get to some sandwiches and eggs even though the spiciness of the Indian curries were great.
Nice vibes, great art and good crowd.

tripreview.Title: "a place with character"
tripreview.sentence: One of my favourite place to read a book.
extremely peaceful with an innate character as its a house turned into a cafeteria preserving authentickerala architecture including a "nadumittam" (open skylight).
The food is also worth the money.

tripreview.Title: "Delicious food in beautiful setting"
tripreview.sentence: This is a great place for fabulous breakfast omlettes.
The portions are huge, toast is hot and the coffee is delicious.
They even accept credit cards, which is quite unusual in Kochin.
The setting is lovely, you're sort of inside/outside and there are cooling fans throughout.
The only complaint I had was that I found the chairs a bit uncomfortable.

tripreview.Title: "go for the food"
tripreview.sentence: Even if you are not into art, it doesnt matter.
the best food outlet in the area.
Worth your wallet too.

tripreview.Title: "temple"
tripreview.sentence: when you are in Ernakulam/Kochi, its important you make a visit to Ernakulathappan temple.
Siva is the idol.
there is sub-idols.
large temple.

tripreview.Title: "Perfect"
tripreview.sentence: Starting with the amazing coffee, this place will pleased you all.
Their food menu is reduced but of excellent quality.
The homemade granolla and iced coffee are the best!
Environment is perfect to relax and have a good time.
Very nice art exposition.
I love this cafe and the service is great!
Worth many visits!

tripreview.Title: "Delicious food amidst charming art"
tripreview.sentence: Kashi has to be my favourite breakfast/ brunch place in Fort Kochi.
My friends and I love its ambience ~ choice art on the walls, a leafy open courtyard, comfortable chairs, and friendly staff who allow you the luxury of being a meditative tourist.

This time, we enjoyed the generous helpings and the perfectly-balanced flavours of every dish we shared over a lazy brunch ~ the chunky bacon and tomato sandwich on brown bread, the pancakes with honey and fruit, the feta and watermelon salad garnished with walnuts and basil, the shredded roast chicken with potato salad.
Each rang true on the tongue.
Would I return to Kashi again?
Without a doubt.

tripreview.Title: "Small Art gallery with Cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Rarely you come across a gallery with a cafe or a cafe with a gallery.
Get a chance to experience the both and have an elite experience.
Small gallery with 3-4 paintings.
If you appreciate and understand the art, best place to visit with a cup of coffee.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely"
tripreview.sentence: We loved the environment, the service and the food.
The place is half outdoor, very leafy and charming.
The menu is delicious, from the fruity breakfasts to the evening soups and salads.
Excellent coffee too (and I'm italian, so coffee is important).

tripreview.Title: "art and cafe"
tripreview.sentence: Very good combination of snacks and art expositions.
Nice paintings and interior decorations.
just one miss : no bear or wines.

tripreview.Title: "Real good place"
tripreview.sentence: We stayed in kochi more then five days and tried a lot of different places for breakfast but most places were not like this beautiful one.

tripreview.Title: "Favorite breakfast place in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: An omelette with cheese and mushrooms for breakfast made one of my days in Kochi.
In addition, the place with very nice vibes in the air, perfect to hang out while simply having some good coffee or tea.

tripreview.Title: "Must go..."
tripreview.sentence: Great food, great Masala tea and great atmosphere.
We went back on many occasions.
Food was very reasonable and to a high quality.
The setting is very arty so it gives you things to look at whilst your waiting for your food.

tripreview.Title: "Food is also Art !!"
tripreview.sentence: Located at one of the narrow back lanes in Fort Kochi is Kasha Art Gallery.
We stopped here on a humid afternoon and were lucky to find a quiet corner to ourself.
This is the kind of cafe where no one rushes you eat and move on.
You come, sit, open your fiction or lonely planet, order and absorb the ambience.
The menu is very european, medium portions, we tried a sandwich and some sprouts with lime juice.
Service was prompt and courteous, not like some other places which prefer foreign tourists over Indians.
Worth a repeat, a definite yes.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: This is a great place to hangout inside a small narrow street in Fort Kochi.
The Place is decorated with Arts and has a multi head statue as well at entrance.
Good Cake and Coffee and there were lot of non Indian customers like us.
We enjoyed the food and ambience here and would recommend the same to other non Indians and Indians who are in Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Great Food ,Quaint Place"
tripreview.sentence: Great Food , lovely atmosphere , the place is a great find in Fort Kochi .

tripreview.Title: "Interesting place"
tripreview.sentence: We have been trying to go and have their banana pie for the past 2 years but with no luck.
The interiors are beautiful with a very nice and calm atmosphere.
We went in the evening so we were killed by the mosquitos.
We waited for 15 mins but couldn't find any servers.
So we decided to pack 8 chocolate and 3 lemon cakes.
After telling it at the counter, and waiting for 5 minutes, they came and told that the lemon cake was over.
So we decided to get the chocolate cake which took solid 15 mins.
All said and done, the cake was amazing.
Very good portion size- no complains there.
Would be great if they can have a few extra staff around to get things done in a faster pace.

tripreview.Title: "very very beautiful. Missed opportunity on menu and service (dec 14)"
tripreview.sentence: I went to this coffee place with my gf for brunch and we had a an incredible time.
Also we've got disappointed on the following points : 1/ 45min wait for a lime juice and a hot chocolate is not acceptable.
I want to believe we were really unlucky that day 2/ many of the meal proposed on the card sound absolutely delicious!
Unfortunately, we never got to taste them as they were all unavailable.
(Unlucky again?
) 3/ we had to wait ~20min before being assigned to a table.
Its good because then the place doesn't get crowded but also bad cause well
You have to wait (haha.
) My gf also described the crowd there as 'posh old english ppl' and 'pretentious hipsters' whatever that mean haha.
Perso, I loved the place.
It they improve the few mention point and bring the service standard to the same level as their aesthetic standards this place will be like
Wouah !

tripreview.Title: "Interesting collection"
tripreview.sentence: Thoroughly enjoyed little time I had at hand before heading to backwaters.
There was a good mix of artifacts, paintings and other collections that art lovers would truly enjoy !

tripreview.Title: "Outstanding food, quaint little place :)"
tripreview.sentence: Loved the fresh food, laid back feel and fusion menu.
Offerings are limited, but the attention to detail is amazing.
Every dish is cooked to perfection and presented well.
The art gallery has a quaint old feel, yet contemporary.
Loved the open air nooks and crannies, service is a bit slow but efficient, and with a smile !
Would definitely visit again.

tripreview.Title: "Love the atmosphere"
tripreview.sentence: I visit Kashi whenever I'm in Fort Kochi.
I love the open, lively and unique atmosphere of this cafe.
The cakes and sandwiches are worth a try.

tripreview.Title: "Great for a relaxing brekkie"
tripreview.sentence: Loved this place, great food, good service and an arty relaxing atmosphere.
The food does take a while to arrive but it's all freshly cooked and worth the wait.

tripreview.Title: "Delightful surprise "
tripreview.sentence: I was really looking for a place to sit and have a light meal when I came across Kashi.
Now, I may have been lucky but if the kind of art at display at Kashi are always of the caliber of Pouya Aryanpour, then you have to pop in.
Of course the fact that this place has a nice ambience and good service at its cafe/restaurant doesn't hurt.

tripreview.Title: "Great place for a rest and snack"
tripreview.sentence: We came here a few time for coffee, great ginger lime soda, cake and once a salad lunch.
It is always very busy and you have to wait a bit for your food, but really not too long.
The art work is interesting and the whole atmosphere is relaxed and cozy.
It is a good place to meet other travellers but is also very popular with the locals.
I always say, where the locals go, must be good.
Very clean and well kept place.
It should not be classified as an "attraction" by Trip Advisor, should be under the restaurant or cafe category.

tripreview.Title: "Best place for Coffee and Breakfast!"
tripreview.sentence: Beautiful artwork, great coffee and yummy healthy breakfast.
We got there right on opening time at 8:30am and the place was full within 15 minutes.
My husband was disappointed that bacon and eggs was on the lunch menu, and not on breakfast menu.
Breakfast menu Is mainly toasts, cereals and fruits, and a few types of omelette.
I would recommend for the atmosphere, the art and drinks and light refreshments.

tripreview.Title: "love everything"
tripreview.sentence: Loved this place so much.
We stayed in the hotel right across the street and where in here all the time.
The coffee was the best in India that I'd found, all the food was fantastic, loved the chocolate cake (extra sauce), cinammon cake breakfast and the yoghurt and cereal breakfast too.
All of the staff where lovely too, really friendly, helpfull, promt service and even though we were there almost every day, always happy to see us!

tripreview.Title: "good artsy cafe but don't go for main meal"
tripreview.sentence: The cafe has a really nice atmosphere and look, and the drinks are delicious.
I especially recommend the hot chocolate and ginger lemonade.
But don't bother eating a meal there - my veg lasagne was really not great!

tripreview.Title: "nice lemon drink"
tripreview.sentence: nice arty place to have a drink.
Some artwork displayed, the lemon herbal drink was delicious and very refreshing.
it is a very nice place to sit and meet friends and enjoy some time.

tripreview.Title: "excellent food"
tripreview.sentence: this is a great little cafe with a variety on the menu.
The surroundings are very pleasant and there is always a crowd waiting for food.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place to chill out"
tripreview.sentence: A must-visit in Fort Kochi.
The food and drinks are average, but the ambience and vibe are the real winners.

tripreview.Title: "Clean, interesting and good vibe."
tripreview.sentence: You can see into the kitchens and the staff are wearing hair nets which is pretty stanard in Europe but not so common in India.
So hygiene was good, the menu is interesting (mix of European and Indian) and the value was very good.
The vibe is nice, mainly tourists but some Indians too and with the art gallery theme it's pretty cool place.
I had a problem with a pot of coffe I ordered (too cold) but there was no argument, they replaced it immediately without question.
Great place and returned several times.
Oy's by contrast was not great
they advertised a big menu outside but had very little when I went in.

tripreview.Title: "Nice oasis."
tripreview.sentence: Buzzy, groovy spot with the best ginger lemonade.
Lovely respite from the cut and thrust of auto drivers and tat dealers.
Well turned out with interesting art works and good atmosphere.
